result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrise L Townsend

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrise L Townsend not in court, in custody.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. appeared by video for Derrise L Townsend.  Attorney Jon Josephsen appeared in court on behalf of Patricia Irene Daugherty for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel advises that parties are still in negotiations and are requesting a PGP date for possible resolution. Court grants request. Case adjourned for a plea hearing date to Br 16.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Derrise L Townsend not in court, in custody.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court for Derrise L Townsend.  Attorney Annie Louk appeared in court on behalf of Patricia Irene Daugherty for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. State provides an update to the court. Further, the Court calendars the next court date for an another status conference date to allot the State additional time to make a decision. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Derrise L Townsend not in court, in custody.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court for Derrise L Townsend.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken for Patricia Irene Daugherty in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and offer and requested adjournment due to defendant having another case pending in another county.  Court granted defense request.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; IN PERSON.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrise L Townsend in court by video with Attorney Frederick F Klimetz who appears in person.  Defendant Derrise L Townsend in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Frederick Klimetz in court in person. Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Klimetz is newly retained and needs time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derrise L Townsend not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Certified Copy of Judgment of Conviction Lincoln County Case 18CF66 received and filed.  bm

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Derrise L Townsend in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Derrise L Townsend in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derrise L Townsend appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
